author: mbk
msg: It is with great joy that I present what will hopefully be the last
in a series of commits related to issue 1037 (repository uuids).
This one removes the sending of UUIDs as part of the update report.
It is semantically equivalent to the change made in rev 5245 as part
of the release of 0.19.  However, this change excises the evil code
rather than simply ifdef-ing a portion of it out.
This is a reversion of a portion of rev 4916.
(close_helper): Do not include <S2:repository-uuid> in <S:prop> block for
(upd_set_target_revision): Do not include S2 namespace in <S:update-report>
(upd_change_xxx_prop): Do not populate baton's uuid from UUID property.

author: kfogel
msg: Finish issue #1004: make 'svn cleanup', 'svn copy', and 'svn move'
cancellable, and improve the cancellability of 'svn add'.
(svn_client_cleanup): Take new ctx parameter, pass cancellation func
and baton from the ctx along to svn_wc_cleanup.
(svn_wc_cleanup, svn_wc_add, svn_wc_copy): Take new cancel_func and
(svn_io_copy_dir_recursively): Check for cancellation.  Also, add a
pair of curly braces for ISO Pilato Compliance.
(svn_cl__cleanup): Extract client ctx from the baton, pass it to
(svn_wc_cleanup): Take new cancel_func and cancel_baton args, use
them to check for cancellation, and pass them to recursive call.
(svn_wc_add): Pass cancel_func and cancel_baton along to mark_tree.
(copy_file_administratively): Pass nulls for cancellation func and
args, pass them along to svn_wc_cleanup, svn_wc_add, and
(svn_wc_copy): Take new cancel_func and cancel_baton args, pass
(remove_tmpfiles): Take cancel_func and cancel_baton, check for

author: kfogel
msg: (main): Remove const qualifier from `arg', to silence an "assignment

author: gstein
msg: (Sandbox.cleanup_test_paths): no need to use 'global' unless you're
actually assigning to the specified variable.
